trans-unit.source: Performs a bit-block transfer of color data from the specified rectangle in the source DC to the specified parallelogram in the DC context

seg-source.mrk: Performs a bit-block transfer of color data from the specified rectangle in the source DC to the specified parallelogram in the DC context

target.mrk: Performs a bit-block transfer of color data from the specified rectangle in the source DC to the specified parallelogram in the DC context

trans-unit.source: Parameters
Handle to the destination device context.

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the destination device context.

target.mrk: Handle to the destination device context.

trans-unit.source: The 2D array ([x1, y1], [x2, y2], [x3, y3]) that identify three corners of the destination parallelogram.

seg-source.mrk: The 2D array ([x1, y1], [x2, y2], [x3, y3]) that identify three corners of the destination parallelogram.

target.mrk: The 2D array ([x1, y1], [x2, y2], [x3, y3]) that identify three corners of the destination parallelogram.

trans-unit.source: The upper-left corner of the source rectangle is mapped to the first point in this array, the upper-right

seg-source.mrk: The upper-left corner of the source rectangle is mapped to the first point in this array, the upper-right

target.mrk: The upper-left corner of the source rectangle is mapped to the first point in this array, the upper-right

trans-unit.source: corner to the second point in this array, and the lower-left corner to the third point. The lower-right

seg-source.mrk: corner to the second point in this array, and the lower-left corner to the third point.

target.mrk: corner to the second point in this array, and the lower-left corner to the third point.

trans-unit.source: corner of the source rectangle is mapped to the implicit fourth point in the parallelogram.

seg-source.mrk: corner of the source rectangle is mapped to the implicit fourth point in the parallelogram.

target.mrk: corner of the source rectangle is mapped to the implicit fourth point in the parallelogram.

trans-unit.source: Handle to the source device context.

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the source device context.

target.mrk: Handle to the source device context.

trans-unit.source: The x-coordinate, in logical units, of the upper-left corner of the source rectangle.

seg-source.mrk: The x-coordinate, in logical units, of the upper-left corner of the source rectangle.

target.mrk: The x-coordinate, in logical units, of the upper-left corner of the source rectangle.

trans-unit.source: The y-coordinate, in logical units, of the upper-left corner of the source rectangle.

seg-source.mrk: The y-coordinate, in logical units, of the upper-left corner of the source rectangle.

target.mrk: The y-coordinate, in logical units, of the upper-left corner of the source rectangle.

trans-unit.source: The width, in logical units, of the source rectangle.

seg-source.mrk: The width, in logical units, of the source rectangle.

target.mrk: The width, in logical units, of the source rectangle.

trans-unit.source: The height, in logical units, of the source rectangle.

seg-source.mrk: The height, in logical units, of the source rectangle.

target.mrk: The height, in logical units, of the source rectangle.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Handle to the monochrome bitmap that is used to mask the colors of the source rectangle.

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the monochrome bitmap that is used to mask the colors of the source rectangle.

target.mrk: Handle to the monochrome bitmap that is used to mask the colors of the source rectangle.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The x-coordinate, in logical units, of the upper-left corner of the monochrome bitmap. Default is 0.

seg-source.mrk: The x-coordinate, in logical units, of the upper-left corner of the monochrome bitmap.

target.mrk: The x-coordinate, in logical units, of the upper-left corner of the monochrome bitmap.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The y-coordinate, in logical units, of the upper-left corner of the monochrome bitmap. Default is 0.

seg-source.mrk: The y-coordinate, in logical units, of the upper-left corner of the monochrome bitmap.

target.mrk: The y-coordinate, in logical units, of the upper-left corner of the monochrome bitmap.

trans-unit.source: Return Value
True
False
Remarks
The _WinAPI_PlgBlt() works with device-dependent bitmaps. If the source and destination device contexts represent

seg-source.mrk: If the source and destination device contexts represent

target.mrk: If the source and destination device contexts represent

trans-unit.source: incompatible devices, the function returns an error.

seg-source.mrk: incompatible devices, the function returns an error.

target.mrk: incompatible devices, the function returns an error.

trans-unit.source: The fourth vertex of the parallelogram (D) is defined by treating the first three points (A, B, and C) as vectors

seg-source.mrk: The fourth vertex of the parallelogram (D) is defined by treating the first three points (A, B, and C) as vectors

target.mrk: The fourth vertex of the parallelogram (D) is defined by treating the first three points (A, B, and C) as vectors

trans-unit.source: and computing D = B + CA.
If the bitmask is specified, a value of 1 in the mask indicates that the source pixel color should be copied to the

seg-source.mrk: If the bitmask is specified, a value of 1 in the mask indicates that the source pixel color should be copied to the

target.mrk: If the bitmask is specified, a value of 1 in the mask indicates that the source pixel color should be copied to the

trans-unit.source: destination. A value of 0 in the mask indicates that the destination pixel color is not to be changed. If the mask

seg-source.mrk: A value of 0 in the mask indicates that the destination pixel color is not to be changed.

target.mrk: A value of 0 in the mask indicates that the destination pixel color is not to be changed.

trans-unit.source: rectangle is smaller than the source and destination rectangles, the function replicates the mask pattern.

seg-source.mrk: rectangle is smaller than the source and destination rectangles, the function replicates the mask pattern.

target.mrk: rectangle is smaller than the source and destination rectangles, the function replicates the mask pattern.

trans-unit.source: Scaling, translation, and reflection transformations are allowed in the source device context; however, rotation

seg-source.mrk: Scaling, translation, and reflection transformations are allowed in the source device context; however, rotation

target.mrk: Scaling, translation, and reflection transformations are allowed in the source device context; however, rotation

trans-unit.source: and shear transformations are not. If the mask bitmap is not a monochrome bitmap, an error occurs. The stretching

seg-source.mrk: If the mask bitmap is not a monochrome bitmap, an error occurs.

target.mrk: If the mask bitmap is not a monochrome bitmap, an error occurs.

target.mrk: mode for the destination device context is used to determine how to stretch or compress the pixels, if that is
